00032 #ifndef ATCHANNEL_H
00033 #define ATCHANNEL_H 1

00039 /* Define AT_DEBUG to send AT traffic to "/tmp/radio-at.log" */
00040 #define AT_DEBUG  0
00041 
00042 #if AT_DEBUG
00043 extern void  AT_DUMP(const char* prefix, const char*  buff, int  len);
00044 #else
00045 #define  AT_DUMP(prefix,buff,len)  do{}while(0)
00046 #endif
00047 
00048 #define AT_ERROR_GENERIC -1
00049 #define AT_ERROR_COMMAND_PENDING -2
00050 #define AT_ERROR_CHANNEL_CLOSED -3
00051 #define AT_ERROR_TIMEOUT -4
00052 #define AT_ERROR_INVALID_THREAD -5    /* AT commands may not be issued from
00053                                          reader thread (or unsolicited response
00054                                          callback */
00055 #define AT_ERROR_INVALID_RESPONSE -6  /* Eg an at_send_command_singleline that
00056                                          did not get back an intermediate
00057                                          response */
00058 
00059 
00060 typedef enum {
00061     NO_RESULT,      /* No intermediate response expected. */
00062     NUMERIC,        /* A single intermediate response starting with a 0-9. */
00063     SINGLELINE,     /* A single intermediate response starting with a prefix. */
00064     MULTILINE,      /* Multiple line intermediate response
00065                        starting with a prefix. */
00066 
00067     /* Multiple value intermediate response. Only the first line starts with a
00068        prefix, but all the remaining intermediate lines are part of the command
00069        output.
00070      */
00071     MULTIVALUE
00072     
00073 } ATCommandType;
00074 
00076 typedef struct ATLine  {
00077     struct ATLine *p_next;
00078     char *line;
00079 } ATLine;
00080 
00082 typedef struct {
00083     int success;              /* True if final response indicates
00084                                  success (eg "OK"). */
00085     char *finalResponse;      /* Eg OK, ERROR */
00086     ATLine  *p_intermediates; /* Any intermediate responses. */
00087 } ATResponse;
00088 
00095 typedef void (*ATUnsolHandler)(const char *s, const char *sms_pdu);
00096 
00097 int at_open(char *ttynamep, ATUnsolHandler h, int atopendelay, int closetime);
00098 void at_close();
00099 
00100 /*
00101  * Set default timeout for at commands. Let it be reasonable high
00102  * since some commands take their time. Default is 10 minutes.
00103  */
00104 void at_set_timeout_msec(int timeout);
00105 
00106 /* 
00107  * This callback is invoked on the command thread.
00108  * You should reset or handshake here to avoid getting out of sync.
00109  */
00110 void at_set_on_timeout(void (*onTimeout)(void));
00111 
00112 /*
00113  * This callback is invoked on the reader thread (like ATUnsolHandler), when the
00114  * input stream closes before you call at_close (not when you call at_close()).
00115  * You should still call at_close(). It may also be invoked immediately from the
00116  * current thread if the read channel is already closed.
00117  */
00118 void at_set_on_reader_closed(void (*onClose)(void));

00120 void at_send_escape(void);

00128                                              ATResponse **pp_outResponse,
00129                                              int timeoutMsec);

00156     CME_SUCCESS = 0,
